description:
Update: Thankyou for sharing the resumes with us. The position is now in the process for evaluation. I will not be taking any further applications for this position.


We’re hiring a Head of IT for one of the known oil and gas organization based in Karachi.

Minimum Education Minimum Bachelors in Computer Sciences, Masters in a related subject is desirable.

Minimum Experience 08 to 10 years

JOB SUMMARY
Overseeing all technology operations of the organization and evaluating them according to established goals. Devising and establishing IT policies and systems to support the implementation of strategies. Analyzing the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Manage a portfolio of technology projects to meet cost, scope, and schedule constraints.
2. Collaborates with and manages IT teams across the group to provide consistent and enhanced customer experience.
3. Ensure network components meet needs and work together seamlessly, using the full range of capabilities, and stay informed about new features and competitive solutions.
4. Prepare cost benefits analysis reports when upgrades are necessary, continuously analyzing vendors to ensure they offer the best possible service and value for company needs, and make recommendations for improving the IT infrastructure.
5. Constructing and implementing plans to ensure the company’s network continues to operate smoothly in the event
of a problem and developing short and long-term IT strategies to support the overall requirement.
6. Select and implement suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefits.
7. Design, evaluate, implement, and monitor Microsoft databases backups, business continuity, and disaster recovery plan.
8. Responsible for handling the routine IT operations & manageability of IT infrastructure & set-up.
9. Ensures the company's data remains secure by keeping up to date on the latest cyber security threats and finds ways to guard against them on an Company-wide scale.
10. Using software/hardware diagnostic tools to respond to network alarms, network degradation, and failures by diagnosing and initiating network recovery process
11. Provide analysis and technical solutions to a variety of problems that are routinely encountered under normal business activities.
12. Ensure tight collaboration across departments to drive strategic initiatives, including understanding of the alignment between technology strategy and various technology road maps.
13. Delivering customer satisfaction and overall excellence by identifying opportunities (or issues) and assisting with speedy resolution.

Interested candidates may share their resumes on saima.aboobaker@hrsgonline.com

description:
A 3-day Workshop (Training) on “Accidents Prevention and Investigation in Oil and Gas Sector through Root Cause and Failure Analysis (RCFA)” was arranged for the field personnel of seismic parties, drilling rigs and gas processing plants at OGTI which was conducted by Muhammad Mubashir Abbas, HOD-HSEQ/ Lead HSEQ Instructor (OGTI), from December 14 to 16, 2022 to impart knowledge on RCFA to enable Professionals to identify & eliminate causes such as potential and design root behind failures in complex systems, subsystems, and components. And another objective was to share the concepts needed to effectively perform (troubleshooting) investigations to fundamentally find & solve incidents/ equipment failures to run operations on prudent basis.

Root Cause Analysis methods employing STEP (Sequential Time Event Plotting), Failure Mode & Effect Analysis (FMEA), Bowtie Analysis, Swiss Cheese Diagram, Cause & Effect (Fishbone) Diagram and Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) were discussed in detail.

Safety pyramid; 4M; Learning Cycles; Maintenance Strategies (Reactive, Periodic, Predictive and Proactive); Questioning & interviewing techniques; Components analysis (Forensic results); and Leading & Lagging Indicators were also taught with practical examples and implications.

The intensive 3-day course program consisted of a blend of tutorials, workshops and hands-on activities (case studies). The participants worked in five small teams, each led by an experienced fellow. Every participant worked within the team through each phase of an RCFA scenario with live face-to-face interventions and a variety of corporate documents, checklists, questionnaires and tested results to simulate the execution of an actual investigation.

The main lessons learned (feedback from Workshop delegates) a) safety pyramid & leading indicators should never be neglected; b) recurrence of accidents can be avoided if RCFA is properly applied through triple loop learning; c) accurate documentation is the backbone of RCFA; d) if tactfully applied in the workplace, RCFA certainly reduces the cost of maintenance & the cost of failure (revenues are sustained); and e) a forward looking culture instead of reactive culture if encouraged, certainly reduces production expenditures.

description:
I would like to thank Government College University (GCU), Lahore & IEEE GCU Student Branch for inviting me at IEEE WIE International Leadership Summit as a guest speaker to share views about "Socio-economic impact in Energy transition, keeping in view the climate catastrophe" and share panel with worthy speakers Tauseef H. Farooqi Halima Khan Syed Faizan Ali Shah, PMP®, P.E., MSc Elect EngAijaz Ahmed Siddiqui Usman Anwar. The pandemic and most recently the Russian-Ukranian war has exposed two crises: the climate crisis and the energy crisis. The solution to both is Renewable Energy. We are currently seeing in many markets is that non-Energy sectors are also getting their act together with sustainability and green transition strategies. We see in the Petrochemicals sector in KSA, in the steel sector in Oman, in the fertilizer business in Morocco and also in the Oil & Gas industry with the development of Carbon Capture and Storage solution, making green hydrogen the zero-emission fuel of the future.
#EnergyTransition requires radical #transformation in the complete supply chain of #production & #consumption in all the sectors that are using #energy in any form.
We are reaching temperature rise of 3 degrees Celsius by 2030, according to the latest reports; and that is detrimental to all kinds of Life on this planet if we don't act now and scale up renewables. Our biodiversity will be significantly at stake which is the source of our ability to live as humans on this planet. #renewableenergy #sustainability #saveenvironment #climatecrisis

description:
I have more than 30 years of experience in the professional field with “19” years in the Crude Oil Refinery and 6th years in SIEMENS Pakistan, I started my career at Zelin Pvt Ltd. During my service period in SIEMENS & Zelin I performed Engineering, Installation, and Commissioning on a different type of plants such as Power Generation, Oil & Gas Exploration, Hydrocarbon Crude Oil Refineries, Petro Chemical, and Fertilizer.
After serving 6th year in SIEMENS Pakistan I joined CNERGYICO Pakistan (Formally BYCO Petroleum Pakistan Limited), a 1,40,000 Barrel Crude Oil Refinery (One of the largest Refining Complex in Pakistan) during this period I was involved in Plant Maintenance, Conversion from Pneumatic to DCS, Engineering for Revamp Project, Installation & Commissioning of Instrument and major part during startup after revamp.
For the last 5 years, I have been performing as a Head of the Department (Instrumentation).
Have the ability to work independently and as a Team player and an innovator who is willing to go the extra mile to achieve company objectives. Self-motivated and a quick learner, constantly studying and training to keep in touch with new technologies.

description:
Paleozoic Sequences as Potential Source Rocks for Petroleum in Northwestern Pakistan, with Particular
Reference to the Silurian System, a Major Petroleum Source in the Middle East and North Africa*
Syed Tariq Hasany1
and Fazl-i-Rabbi Khan2
Search and Discovery Article #30263 (2012)**
Posted December 31, 2012

*Adapted from oral presentation at PAPG Annual Technical Conference 2003, Islamabad, Pakistan, October 3-5, 2003
**AAPG © 2012 Serial rights given by author. For all other rights contact author directly.
1
Petronas Carigali Sdn-Bhd, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia (hasany.syedtariq@petronas.com.my; tariqhasany@hotmail.com)
2National Centre of Excellence in Geology, Peshwar University, Peshwar, Pakistan (nceg@brian.net.pk)

Abstract

Silurian sequences in the Middle East and North Africa have been demonstrated to be major petroleum source rocks. The principal sources
were black shales mostly of Early Silurian (Llandovery) age representing major events of anoxia. It is estimated that 9% of the world’s
petroleum reserves have been derived from Silurian source rocks. Devonian sequences have also contributed importantly as source rocks and
also as host rocks for petroleum production in North Africa and Canada.
The Palaeozoic sequences of Pakistan and stratigraphic alignments between them are not well known, but a significant Silurian dark shale
sequence with high organic content, the Lun Shale (Llandovery, identified by graptolites), is known from Chitral. It is, admittedly, much
disturbed structurally, having been involved in the Himalayan Orogeny, but what happened (or may have happened) farther south during
Silurian times is poorly known. Silurian sediments are nevertheless known from the Nowshera-Misri Banda area where the base of the
Nowshera Limestone and underlying Kandar Formation (senior synonym of Panjpir Formation of Pogue et al., 1992) and, underlying that
again, the Misri Banda Quartzite, are, despite poor exposures, potentially sources of much information about events during Silurian times in
northern Pakistan. There is a modicum of information on the Devonian sequences around the Peshawar Basin and into the tribal areas.
Farther westwards in southern Afghanistan (such as the Dasht-i-Narwar) and Iran, Silurian sequences are associated with Devonian sequences. Colour Alteration Indices of conodonts from some of the latter sequences, such as in the vicinity of Tabas, fall within the oil and
gas windows. Conceivably, the same situation may occur with mid-Palaeozoic (including Silurian) sequences concealed beneath the Mesozoic-Cainozoic sedimentary blanket of northwestern Pakistan.

description: In the current episode, the USD and commodity prices have shown a positive co-movement unlike previously when they had an inverse relationship. Increases in oil and gas prices now improve the US terms of trade and tend to boost the US dollar, with any related monetary tightening further bolstering the currency.

description:
One of my connection is looking for Head of IT for one of the known oil and gas organization based in Karachi.

Minimum Education Minimum Bachelors in Computer Sciences, Masters in a related subject is desirable.

Minimum Experience 08 to 10 years

JOB SUMMARY
Overseeing all technology operations of the organization and evaluating them according to established goals. Devising and establishing IT policies and systems to support the implementation of strategies. Analyzing the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Manage a portfolio of technology projects to meet cost, scope, and schedule constraints.
2. Collaborates with and manages IT teams across the group to provide consistent and enhanced customer experience.
3. Ensure network components meet needs and work together seamlessly, using the full range of capabilities, and stay informed about new features and competitive solutions.
4. Prepare cost benefits analysis reports when upgrades are necessary, continuously analyzing vendors to ensure they offer the best possible service and value for company needs, and make recommendations for improving the IT infrastructure.
5. Constructing and implementing plans to ensure the company’s network continues to operate smoothly in the event
of a problem and developing short and long-term IT strategies to support the overall requirement.
6. Select and implement suitable technology to streamline all internal operations and help optimize their strategic benefits.
7. Design, evaluate, implement, and monitor Microsoft databases backups, business continuity, and disaster recovery plan.
8. Responsible for handling the routine IT operations & manageability of IT infrastructure & set-up.
9. Ensures the company's data remains secure by keeping up to date on the latest cyber security threats and finds ways to guard against them on an Company-wide scale.
10. Using software/hardware diagnostic tools to respond to network alarms, network degradation, and failures by diagnosing and initiating network recovery process
11. Provide analysis and technical solutions to a variety of problems that are routinely encountered under normal business activities.
12. Ensure tight collaboration across departments to drive strategic initiatives, including understanding of the alignment between technology strategy and various technology road maps.
13. Delivering customer satisfaction and overall excellence by identifying opportunities (or issues) and assisting with speedy resolution.

Interested candidates may share their resumes on saima.aboobaker@hrsgonline.com

description:
SOEs in Reko Diq deposit $562.5m

Following the signing of a final agreement 'with respect to the SOEs' participation in the reconstituted Reko Diq project,' according to a bourse filing on Friday, Pakistan's three state-owned entities (SOEs), which hold a 25% stake in the Balochistani project Reko Diq, have deposited $562.5 million in an escrow account.

It was discovered that the money put into the escrow account is to be used to carry out an out-of-court settlement of a dispute with Tethyan Copper Company, a partnership between Barrick Gold Corporation of Canada and Antofagasta of Chile, regarding the Reko Diq Copper-Gold Project in the Chagai district of Balochistan.

We are happy to announce that Pakistan Petroleum Limited (PPL), Oil and Gas Development Company Limited (OGDCL), and Government Holdings (Private) Limited, collectively the state-owned enterprises, have signed the definitive agreements (final agreements) regarding the SOEs' participation in the reconstituted Reko Diq project, PPL said in a notification sent to Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX). A similar notification was also delivered to PSX by OGDCL.

According to the final agreements, Pakistan Minerals (Private) Limited, a special purpose vehicle (SPV) jointly and equally owned by the SOEs and the firm (PPL) participated in the project.

The SOE SPV eventually purchased a 25% stake in the project from an existing project stakeholder (first stage acquisition) as part of the transaction and execution plan agreed upon under the definitive agreements, the notice stated.

Each SOE paid an equal amount of the consideration for the first stage acquisition on behalf of the SOE SPV. The SOEs used funds that were deposited in an interest-bearing, offshore escrow account to accomplish this; these funds, in addition to the interest that had already accumulated, totaling $562.5 million.

The company's proportionate share of the total was $187.5 million, plus the related proportional accrued interest, it said.

The SOE SPV's interest in the project is reformed through a number of offshore holding entities after the first stage acquisition is finished. The SOEs' 25% ownership of the project hasn't altered, though.

The definitive agreements set down the rights and responsibilities of the SOEs and the SOE SPV with regard to the project and the other project participants. The notice stated that these rights and obligations pertain to, among other things, management, reporting, funding, and governance.
dateposted: Following the signing of a final agreement 'with respect to the SOEs' participation in the reconstituted Reko Diq project,' according to a bourse filing on Friday, Pakistan's three state-owned entities (SOEs), which hold a 25% stake in the Balochistani project Reko Diq, have deposited $562.5 million in an escrow account.

It was discovered that the money put into the escrow account is to be used to carry out an out-of-court settlement of a dispute with Tethyan Copper Company, a partnership between Barrick Gold Corporation of Canada and Antofagasta of Chile, regarding the Reko Diq Copper-Gold Project in the Chagai district of Balochistan.

We are happy to announce that Pakistan Petroleum Limited (PPL), Oil and Gas Development Company Limited (OGDCL), and Government Holdings (Private) Limited, collectively the state-owned enterprises, have signed the definitive agreements (final agreements) regarding the SOEs' participation in the reconstituted Reko Diq project, PPL said in a notification sent to Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX). A similar notification was also delivered to PSX by OGDCL.
According to the final agreements, Pakistan Minerals (Private) Limited, a special purpose vehicle (SPV) jointly and equally owned by the SOEs and the firm (PPL) participated in the project.

The SOE SPV eventually purchased a 25% stake in the project from an existing project stakeholder (first stage acquisition) as part of the transaction and execution plan agreed upon under the definitive agreements, the notice stated.

Each SOE paid an equal amount of the consideration for the first stage acquisition on behalf of the SOE SPV. The SOEs used funds that were deposited in an interest-bearing, offshore escrow account to accomplish this; these funds, in addition to the interest that had already accumulated, totaling $562.5 million.
The company's proportionate share of the total was $187.5 million, plus the related proportional accrued interest, it said.

The SOE SPV's interest in the project is reformed through a number of offshore holding entities after the first stage acquisition is finished. The SOEs' 25% ownership of the project hasn't altered, though.

description:
Good People, I am withdrawing my public support of the recently unveiled Central Bank of Bank’s policy on cash withdrawal limit. I had supported that initiative on the construct that it would help Nigeria deal with its tax problems. Yes, while we continue to think we can rise with oil and gas, the ascension for Nigeria will only come, when we can generate decent taxable economic activities to finance the future in education, healthcare, etc.

But after learning how Nigeria was unable to reconcile how much was collected on stamp duty, I see no reason to believe that inconveniencing the citizens, on how they withdraw and spend their money, via an additional regulatory layer beyond what has existed for years, will help. If stamp duty which is collected by banks electronically cannot be traced, and reconciled, through the support of the Central Bank of Nigeria, there is no basis to believe they can become more efficient on tax collection with the new cash withdrawal policy.

I worked in the banking sector in Lagos. I worked in the most classified and most guarded department in the bank - software automation unit. Only the most trusted, vetted and selected get closer. Why? You have access to the bank’s general ledger You are the SUPER-admins of all admins in the bank. Why am I going there? A simple subpoena from the National Assembly will make banks produce the conflicting figures in 6 hours . Just a new line of code from those geeks and you have the numbers. The government can then reconcile.

But I do not think that is the real problem. My conclusion is that banks have done their jobs, remitted the money, but people stole it within the government, and some did not get enough, and magically, they are fighting. Wait, after 2 months, the heat will go and nothing will happen. So, CBN, it's the government that needs a cash withdrawal limit and not companies and citizens; leave us alone!

description:
Canadian mining firm Barrick Gold Corporation (BGC) on Friday said that it had completed the reconstitution of one of the world's largest undeveloped copper-gold projects after receiving nods from Pakistan's top court and parliament.

On Thursday, Pakistan inked the final deal with Barrick and Antofagasta PLC representatives in London to revive the Reko Diq mining project and settle a long-running $11 billion dispute. The development came after the government received a ‘favourable opinion' from the Supreme Court on the settlement agreement and required legislation was passed into law.

Following the agreement, Reko Diq will be owned 50% by Barrick; 25% by three state-owned enterprises — the Oil and Gas Development Company Limited (OGCDL), Pakistan Petroleum Limited (PPL) and Government Holdings Private Limited (GHPL); 15% by Balochistan on a fully-funded basis and 10% by the province on a free-carried basis.

In a statement, Barrick president and chief executive Mark Bristow said completion of the legal processes was key for the development of Reko Diq into "a world-class, long-life mine" which would substantially expand the company’s copper portfolio and "benefit its Pakistani stakeholders for generations to come".

Bristow said that Reko Diq would not contribute to Pakistan’s economy, but also have a transformative impact on the underdeveloped Balochistan province, with 7,500 jobs expected to be created during peak construction and around 4,000 long-term jobs once it reaches the production phase.

“We’re making sure that Balochistan and its people will see these benefits quickly. Starting early next year, Barrick will implement a range of social development programs prioritizing the improvement of healthcare, education, vocational training, food security and the provision of potable water. Our investment in these is expected to amount to around $70 million over the feasibility and construction period," he said.

Bristow said that Reko Diq would not contribute to Pakistan’s economy, but also have a transformative impact on the underdeveloped Balochistan province, with 7,500 jobs expected to be created during peak construction and around 4,000 long-term jobs once it reaches the production phase.

“We’re making sure that Balochistan and its people will see these benefits quickly. Starting early next year, Barrick will implement a range of social development programs prioritizing the improvement of healthcare, education, vocational training, food security and the provision of potable water. Our investment in these is expected to amount to around $70 million over the feasibility and construction period," he said.

description:
"The temperatures have plunged to minus 10 or even lower. Cold air is sweeping across the Continent from the east. We have all had to turn up the heating, and there may well be more freezing weather to come during January and February.
This should have been the week when the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, sat back in his chair in the Kremlin, poured himself a stiff vodka, and toasted the success of his plan to bring Europe to its knees by turning off its energy supplies. Soft, self-indulgent Western Europeans were never likely to be able to withstand the hardship of power cuts. Within weeks, they would have been forced to capitulate.
True, there have been some bottlenecks, electricity prices soared to all-time highs at the start of the week and coal generators had to be put on standby in case they were needed. And yet despite the freeze, the lights stayed on, and the factories just about kept running.
In reality, this was the week when Putin’s master plan unravelled. He has played the energy card, it has failed and he can’t play it again. And the Russian autocrat has trashed his country’s only industry of any significance with nothing to show for it.
[...]
For Putin and the Russian government that is a catastrophe. Probably not very surprisingly for someone who spent his early career in the KGB, and has since surrounded himself with gangsters, Putin has no appreciation for free markets. For all their faults, they are very flexible, and higher prices have a fantastic ability to magic up extra supplies from somewhere or other. The energy card was meant to bully Europe into withdrawing its backing for the Ukrainian government. But it could only be played once. Now that it has failed, Russia can’t bully anyone with it again. The threats are completely hollow.
Even worse, he has trashed his economy in the process. Oil and gas were hardly incidental to Russia. Along with some mines, energy was its only industry of any significance. It accounted for 19pc of GDP in 2019, and for almost half of the Kremlin’s tax revenues. There are still some wheat exports, but that is about it. Russia doesn’t make anything else the world is interested in. And now, it isn’t even going to be a major energy exporter any more.
No one wants to rely on a producer who might threaten to cut off supplies at any moment. Its energy industry might stagger on for a few more years, but it has no real future. Putin has used energy to bully and threaten anyone who gets in his way. But right now he had nothing to show for it. As the weather warms up next week, that will become painfully clear – and his corrupt, murderous regime will be in deep trouble. "

description:
What is orange hydrogen?
Orange hydrogen is a low cost, energy efficient, easily instrumented, chemical process that breaks down traditional hydrocarbon and biofuels (e.g., crude oil, natural gas, gasoline, biogas, etc.) into hydrogen (H2) with no carbon dioxide (CO2) byproduct.

description:
Record contracts + energy security + tens of thousands of jobs + industry transformation

Today, we in Aker Solutions celebrate contracts worth approximately 50 billion Norwegian kroner. Over the next 6 years, we will together with partners deliver complete new offshore installations to several oil and gas field developments for Aker BP ASA.

Together, we will develop these projects with solutions that will place these installations in the global top tier of oil and gas production with the least environmental impact.

The scope of the projects today is historic:

◾We will contribute to the delivery of large amounts of new energy that is crucially important for the world, not least here in Europe.

◾ This will have ripple effects and mean many tens of thousands of jobs in industry and in all the local communities around the industry, from Northern Norway to Southern Norway, and this will contribute billions in value creation to the welfare society

◾ This is Aker Solutions’ largest contract ever, and one of the largest contract award of its kind in modern time.

◾ These projects will give us activity and finances that enable us to transform at the same time. We will further develop expertise, technology, and facilities so that in the future we can also increase the number of assignments for offshore wind, for carbon capture, and for other solutions that contribute to energy with low or no emissions.

Today is truly an important step in the industry transformation and I am proud of how Aker Solutions’ experts will contribute!

description:
Our biggest asset

I was in Qatar last week. The country’s opulence is to be seen to be believed. And given the size of population (<40 lakhs, 80%+ of which are expatriates), it’s just out of the world. The physical infra built for the world cup stands out in both magnificence and scale.

Given the context, the staging of an event of global scale is staggering. And my mind wandered to when India will reach that scale and pre-eminence (we have hosted 2 Asian Games and 1 Commonwealth, but they are not fully global). It is possible that India may win its reported interest to host the 2036 Summer Olympics in Ahmedabad (where coincidentally Doha is also in the fray). But, if and when it happens, it will truly cement our coming on the global stage.

To that, we then come to how Doha can host the world cup. And the answer is in its wealth that gives it standing: its huge natural gas and oil reserves relative to geographic area and population. And we will have to do that too, build wealth. We may not have the natural resources per capita to boast. But I am sure of one thing, having seen it live at Oxyzo and OfBusiness. India has its biggest asset in its youth: they are dreamy, driven and daring. Their productivity will far outstrip what any god gifted resource can ever do. And for each one of us who are a part of this march ahead, it is our duty and dream to contribute to that.

Mind wanders, sometimes. For the good. Here’s to Ahmedabad ‘36.

#lifeatofbusiness
#lifeatoxyzo
OfBusiness
Oxyzo Financial Services

description:
There are two things that make it hard to build a startup in Houston.

1) Investors aren't familiar with SAFE notes.

SAFEs are an equity instrument that was created by Y Combinator and has been used by thousands of startups to raise capital in the early stages.

It's an everyday tool in Silicon Valley, but almost no one in Houston has heard of them.

The reason it's important to clear this educational hurdle is that there are many people in Houston that can invest small checks into startups. A SAFE allows this to happen without a heavy legal burden that costs a lot of money.

It also allows the valuation to be kicked down the road when there is a priced round and a better understanding of the business.

TLDR; SAFE notes allow startups and angel investors to execute quickly and efficiently.

2) Workforce isn't familiar with equity

Houston is home of the most technical workforce in the world, but they're not familiar with equity being a part of the compensation package. (outside of receiving stock options at large, public companies)

You go to Silicon Valley, everyone talks about TC "Total Compensation." Everyone expects to receive equity as part of their comp.

In Houston, from my firsthand experience and talking with other founders, it's apparent that very few people care about receiving equity, only care about cash comp.

I think part of it is people view it through a zero-sum lens like they're clawing out a piece of pie that's finite, instead of realizing that the pie grows in size as a result of their effort.

While there is definitely risk involved, this is how you build wealth and most people in Houston haven't worked in a startup so they're not familiar with it.

The reason it's a problem is that startups have two levers—equity, and cash. And there usually isn't a lot of cash in the business so they need to leverage equity to get talent.

This post was inspired by a conversation with one of my investors, Alyssa Arnold, P.E. who comes from the Oil and Gas world and is an active investor in startups—we've seen all the same pain points.

If there is an interest, we will work to put together content and/or events to educate the community so that Houston can build a thriving startup ecosystem.

description:
Have you seen this amazing First Nations Dot Art Gingerbread House from our superstar Chef Daniel Lyndon? His work never ceases to amaze his colleagues and our clients.

Daniel says, "It was a privilege to be able to share the Gingerbread House with my fellow workmates who sacrifice to be working on an oil and gas platform and will be spending Christmas away from their families and loved ones. This is why Australia is so different from the rest of the world because of the rich history it has. To be able to embrace it through my food and stories is truly my passion." We are lucky to have someone with his talent in our team.

#compassgroupaustralia #cheflife #greatpeople #gingerbreadhouse

description:
PT. IEG Oilfield Indonesia is a Manufacturing Company for oil and gas equipment, we are looking for highly motivated individual to join with our team. For the respective position as below :

1. Dimensional QC Inspector 2 person

Requirements :
• Min 2 years of experience utilizing basic inspection hand tools - Dimensional QC
• Ablity to read engineering drawing
• Ability to identify measuring equipment needed to verify Engineering specifications..
Eg: ID/OD Micrometer, cmm faro laser tracker, cmm faro arm, bore gauge, vernier caliper, bevel protector, profile projector, gauge maker, tread gauge, etc
• Able to work as a team and under pressure


2. Fabrication QC Inspector 3 person

Requirements :
• Min 2 years of experience in metal fabrication as QC inspector
• Ability to read engineering drawing and welding symbol
• Certified cswip 3.0 or equivalent
• Able to work as a team and under pressure


3. QA Engineer 1 person

Requirements :
• Min 3 years of experience as QA Engineer in oil and gas industry if possible
• Have experience in internal audit
• Diploma/Degree in engineering
• Have good knowledge iso 9001:2015
• Able to communicate in English, detail oriented and able to work as a team and under pressure


Please send your complete application to
HR Department
JL. Mas Surya Negara VI No. 2
Kabil Integrated Industrial Estate – Batam 29467
or sent email recruitment@ie-g.com

Note:
• All candidate must have E-KTP, NPWP
• only shortlisted candidate are notified

description:
Please , is it too difficult to organise summits that regard the matters of Africa in Addis Ababa or Kigali or Abuja or anywhere in Africa ??????????????
Must Africa continue to accept it ?🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️

So Presidents Xi , Biden , Putin , Macron , Sinak , Scholz and the rest can not travel to Africa to attend summits that regard Africa ???????????? 🙄🙄

If it were global summits , I could understand . But they travel and take their protuberant bellies ,all the way from Africa to cold places , to talk about Africa 😩😩😩

Great people , likely you despise the power of colonisation on the mind. It has perverted the mind and made Africans think less of themselves🙄🙄

That is when you see African PHD holders and African leaders being useful for the system their training has been created for and useless for their own continent🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️. They don't think out of that frame.

And the vicious cycle continues ...

I hope in Washington they will sign MOUs that will benefit Africa .I am already hearing about signatures for electric vehicles instead of signatures for our oil and gas first 🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️ I hope they are not selling us again oooooooooo🙆🏾‍♀️. Have they asked the permission to their population before signing things ? Have they done referendums based on a specific written proAfrica agenda to know if their populations agree with their proposals ? They should serve the masses ,not that system 🙌🏽


#leaders #power #mentality

description:
We need to start passing laws in African countries that prohibit any active company in Africa from contracting with or investing in companies that divest from oil, natural gas, and coal. Our lives matter.

Wealthy nations and their banks are denying capital to energy companies especially for African projects, wielding their money and power with one simple goal in mind - destroying the African oil and gas industry and increasing energy poverty. Our pension funds have to wake up. We will ramp up the pressure. Stay tuned. We have a plan.

description:
"We will continue drilling because we need it. Anyone asking African countries not to develop fossil fuels, is criminal. It is criminal because they are telling us that we do not have the right to develop. The largest number of members of OPEC, this year, are African countries. #Mozambique is going to become the biggest supplier of gas, #Senegal will become a big supplier of gas, #Nigeria and #EquatorialGuinea will become big suppliers of gas. So, what you will have in 2035, you will have the African continent serving as the biggest supplier of oil and gas" Gabriel Mbaga Obiang Lima.
#oilandgas #gas #drilling

description:
After 11 amazing years in the national oil and gas sector with different places, roles and responsibilities, the time has come for a new chapter in my career.

I’m happy to announce that I started a new position as Well planning geophysicist at bp energy!

Thankful for God above all, my family and many others for everything I got that lead to where I am today.

And I'm full of Energy and will, to make this another fruitful and successful chapter of my career along with the amazing bp community and together help bp transition to net zero for a more sustainable future.

description:
I am happy to share that I have graduated with MSc in Business Analytics, with Distinction, from Arizona State University. I am particularly proud to have achieved a Distinction grade (4.0 GPA!) in my course of study, with a fulltime job, and being a new mom. It took me countless all-nighters, lots of early mornings, and so much more, to get to this point, but definitely it was all worth it…
I’m also very grateful that my family was able to join me to attend and celebrate my graduation in Arizona State University graduation ceremonies, and a little more grateful to have baby Adam, who arrived to the world mid-way through my studies and made things 100x harder for me haha, cheering for me while I walk down the stage with my diploma.
The skills I've learned at WP Carey School of Business will remain with me for a lifetime. My degree in Business Analytics has closed the business and analytics knowledge gap in my portfolio. I learned how big data is changing every sector of the economy, I learned to derive value from data and modeling, I learned to lead data-driven analysis. I learned to speak the language of data across different markets.
I look forward to utilizing what I’ve learned to create critical business advantages in the oil and gas industry, and to continue to grow both personally and professionally…

Let’s challenge the present to shape the future and “make business personal”!

I want to thank Abdulla Al Ghurair Foundation for Education for their support, without whom I couldn’t have done all of this. Thank you for your commitment to facilitate education for youths who want to give back to and support their countries and the region.

#msba #wpc #asu #wpcarey #businessschool #forksup #agfe #businessanalytics #oilandgas

description: So after 46 years of working in the industrial and energy sector, 40 years of which have been in oil and gas, I am retiring from full time work to reconnect with our family in the UK and to spend more time with our grandchildren and twins who are expected in January. I started out as a young electrical design engineer in 1976 in Yorkshire and then joined the offshore oil and gas industry in 1982 as an Electrical Engineer. I morphed into HSE in 1992 in the wake of the Cullen Inquiry into the Piper Alpha disaster and for a time looked after compliance on, among other major installations, Piper Bravo, working as an offshore Inspector of Health and Safety. In 2001 I joined Total Energies and worked in the North Sea, Yemen, Abu Dhabi and Kazakhstan then I joined ConocoPhillips in 2013 to work in Angola, Aberdeen and Australia where I have been for 6 years working in APLNG. I have been fortunate to work on incredible projects for great organisations and to have in certain cases made a difference to people and the environment. Time now to ease off for a while and enjoy Christmas and the Family and reconnect with our friends.

description:
Nice attempt from President Biden to restore healthy links with Africa but i will believe him when Africa will be allowed to partner with whoever it wishes to , whether China , Russia or even aliens without any interferences🙌🏽🙌🏽🙌🏽

Even though the US proposes a juicy Investment , it will come in which forms that would be beneficial to the populations ? What are the hidden conditions ? Will the Investment be done for Africa to exploit its oil and gas freely in better terms than before or for green ?
What has happened with previous promises ? Have they been fulfilled ? 🙄



The road is still very long for the US when China has invested many hundreds of Billions of dollars in Africa already ,under no constraints and even when a new player like Russia is offering Investment as well.

May be everything is not about money only. May be everything should start with a profound respect for the African continent🙄🙄

description:
Thursday 22nd Dec ends my career as the head of Pickles Mining and Oil & Gas BUT all is not lost. I'm semi retiring and will stay on to work 3-day weeks doing what I enjoy most – valuing Tonka toys (mining gear) and looking after key clients.

I’ve been at the ‘coal face’ for 48 years and it’s time for the next leaders to shine in my crew. It’s certainly wasn't easy to actually consider retirement and a slow transition is almost the best of both worlds to which I’m appreciative of (so is my wife).

I'm grateful for key leaders who have helped me grow on my professional journey. It took me a while to figure out the type of leader I wanted to be and my time at GE Capital, surrounded by some of the most amazing talent on the planet was the proving ground. Thank you to Chris Hassall for allowing me scope to help you build a better business and to Bruce Connors for supporting both myself and our vertical while helping me flourish in the GM role. You guys have trusted me all the way and I'm proud of what we've accomplished.

Mostly I am grateful to my team, past and present. It’s been an honor to watch you work with integrity, passion and most importantly, humor. It has been a real pleasure working side by side with each of you. Watching you all develop and flourish was my biggest success.

Hope to see you again in the near future and until then, stay safe and be happy.….Wallie

PS: I’m not fully retired so please call me if you need a valuation!!

#notfullyretired #valuationservices

description:
Friday's Energy Absurdity: This Energy Transition is Not Going According to Plan

[Follow me on Twitter at @EnergyAbsurdity]

All you need to know about how the climate alarm lobby’s ‘energy transition’ is going as 2022 comes to its merciful close is to read the headline of a Reuters story this morning: “Global coal consumption to reach all-time high this year - IEA”.

Yikes.

Things were not supposed to go this way, at least according to all the flowery official narratives that hover around this ‘transition.’ By now, global coal usage was supposed to be embarked on a rapid decline, along with global usage of oil and natural gas, all to be replaced with massive farms of gigantic windmills and millions of acres of solar arrays set all across the countryside.

Instead, according to the IEA that is led by a narrative-parrot-in-chief, the clownish Fatih Birol, the world is going to use more coal during 2022 than it has ever used during any year before. In history. You know, ever.

There is so much more at the link below that your mind will come away from reading it irreparably boggled. Go read it anyway.

#energyabsurdity #energy #coal #oil #naturalgas #solar #windenergy #energytransition #IEA #fatihbirol #narrative #propaganda #climatechange #climatealarm

description:
Hey! If you’re new to following me, I talk about #gasturbines, #powerplantengineering, #mechanicalmaintenanceengineer, #turbomachinery, and #rotaryequipments.
#Prevetnive Maintenance #predictivemaintenance #MajorOverhauling #maintenance #Correcttivemaintenace #compressors #pumps #blowers #engines #valves #Oil & Gas Sector
I am enthusiastic about the Turbomachines and their role in heavy industries especially fond of Gas Turbines, Centrifugal Pumps, Positive Displacement Pumps, Gear Pumps, Screw Pumps, Vane Pumps, Gas Blowers, instrument air compressors, axial compressors & centrifugal compressors.
I love to carried out Major Overhauling Projects of Gas Turbines. Non Distractive Testing, DPT Testing of Stator & Rotor Axial Compressor blades, Nozzle & Turbine Buckets.
Clearances of rotor & stator blades, axial clearances of thrust bearings, radial clearances of Journal bearings. #gas #Clerances #Dyepenetration Testing #Blue Test of Turbine Casing #Boroscope of Turbine
✒️

description:
At @karoonenergy since 2012, today I complete 10 years with the company, where I could develop personally and professionally every day, alongside great friends, and partners.
During this period, I participated in large projects in Peru and Brazil. I appreciate the opportunity and confidence of the leadership and all my colleagues.
It would be impossible to fulfill the objectives and reach all the targets without the support of the entire Karoon team, suppliers, and consultants.
With everyone's support, it was possible to disseminate an adequate safety culture, meet regulatory and environmental requirements, valuing respect for the communities in the regions where we operate, non-negotiable pillars for the safe execution of projects and, consequently, resulting in the growth of Karoon Energy.
It has been in business for 30 years, working in heavy industry, including the Oil and Gas sector, which is so essential to the development of the country. I have been involved in projects at PRISMA INDUSTRIAL, SIEMENS, CSN (my great school), El Paso Energy which includes (Termonorte/ Macaé Merchant/ Manaus A, B and Aparecida), El Paso Oil and Gas and currently at Karoon Energy.
I am very grateful for all the encounters that my professional career has provided me, and I hope to continue learning and giving my best.
Thank you very much for the messages received. I take this opportunity to wish you all a Merry Christmas and a prosperous and healthy New Year.
Cheers, Ricardo Canela

Na @karoonenergy desde 2012, hoje completo 10 anos na companhia, onde tenho a oportunidade de evoluir pessoalmente e profissionalmente todos os dias, ao lado de grandes amigos e parceiros.
Durante esse período, participei de grandes projetos no Peru e Brasil. Agradeço a oportunidade e confiança da liderança e de todos os meus colegas.
Seria impossível cumprir os objetivos e atingir todas as metas sem o apoio de toda equipe Karoon, fornecedores e consultores.
Com o apoio de todos foi possível disseminar uma cultura de segurança adequada, atender os requerimentos regulatórios e ambientais, prezando pelo respeito as comunidades das regiões onde operamos, pilares inegociáveis para a realização segura dos projetos e, consequentemente, resultando no crescimento da Karoon Energy.
São 30 anos de trabalho na indústria pesada incluindo o setor de Óleo e Gás, tão essencial ao desenvolvimento do país. Estive envolvido em projetos da PRISMA INDUSTRIAL, SIEMENS, CSN (minha grande escola), El Paso Energy que inclui (Termonorte/ Macaé Merchant/ Manaus A, B e Aparecida), El Paso Óleo e Gás e, atualmente, na Karoon Energy.
Sou muito grato por todos os encontros que minha trajetória profissional me proporcionou e espero seguir aprendendo e entregando o meu melhor.
Muito obrigado pelas mensagens recebidas. Aproveito para desejar um Feliz Natal e um próspero Ano Novo com muita saúde para todos.
Abraço, Ricardo Canela

description:
I am grateful to God for my election into the council of the Nigerian Gas Association, as the next Deputy Secretary General.

The Nigerian Gas Association is the apex organisation representing the varied and numerous stakeholders in the Gas sector within the Nigerian oil and gas industry. I am happy that I will be lending my voice and experience together with other elected officials, to accelerate the industry advocacy and deepen Gas utilisation in Nigeria

Thank you all for your kind words, best wishes, and for giving me your overwhelming support.

description:
I often get asked why I'm pro-oil OR pro-clean.

I'm pro-energy. We need all of it... these words are the same. Oil isn't a bad thing. It's brought us to this moment.

Our industry needs bright minds to keep improving it: it needs entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs to push the boundaries. We need new ideas and solutions, rather than a focus on semantics.

Oil and gas -- it's not going away, but it is changing for the better.

Would love for you to weigh in.

Oil and gas -- it's not going away, but it is changing for the better.

description:
Still letting that sink in, thank you so much for the exhilarating new opportunity.
Can't wait to call Houston home in 2023, and this obsession of mine with oil and gas wells' performance analysis and solutions for subsurface characterization, my full-time endeavor with whitson.

Thanks to Mathias Lia Carlsen, Mohamad Majzoub Dahouk, and Markus Blytt for making me fall in love with the company and our shared goals during the interview process. It was an honor to chat with Dr. Curtis Hays Whitson for his final approval to join the family and I look forward to working together.
Thanks to my graduate advisor Dr. Mike King at Texas A&M for rallying for me through my worst, and teaching me unforgettable research and key life skills. I couldn't have hoped for a better transition out of school.

Happy Holidays, everyone!
Just #gratefulthankfulblessed
dateposted: Still letting that sink in, thank you so much for the exhilarating new opportunity.
Can't wait to call Houston home in 2023, and this obsession of mine with oil and gas wells' performance analysis and solutions for subsurface characterization, my full-time endeavor with whitson.

Thanks to Mathias Lia Carlsen, Mohamad Majzoub Dahouk, and Markus Blytt for making me fall in love with the company and our shared goals during the interview process. It was an honor to chat with Dr. Curtis Hays Whitson for his final approval to join the family and I look forward to working together.

Thanks to my graduate advisor Dr. Mike King at Texas A&M for rallying for me through my worst, and teaching me unforgettable research and key life skills. I couldn't have hoped for a better transition out of school.

description:
Any musings about global oil & gas by Pepe Escobar tend to catch my eye as his alert viewpoints from Asia are usually far different from the Western media bread and circus shiny objects of mass distraction.

====================

"Xi Jinping has made an offer difficult for the Arabian Peninsula to ignore: China will be guaranteed buyers of your oil and gas, but we will pay in yuan.

It would be so tempting to qualify Chinese President Xi Jinping landing in Riyadh a week ago, welcomed with royal pomp and circumstance, as Xi of Arabia proclaiming the dawn of the petroyuan era.

But it’s more complicated than that.

As much as the seismic shift implied by the petroyuan move applies, Chinese diplomacy is way too sophisticated to engage in direct confrontation, especially with a wounded, ferocious Empire.

So there’s way more going here than meets the (Eurasian) eye.

Xi of Arabia’s announcement was a prodigy of finesse: it was packaged as the internationalization of the yuan.

● From now on, Xi said, China will use the yuan for oil trade, through the Shanghai Petroleum and National Gas Exchange, and invited the Persian Gulf monarchies to get on board.

● Nearly 80 percent of trade in the global oil market continues to be priced in US dollars.

● China has been the largest importer of crude on the planet for five years now – half of it from the Arabian peninsula, and more than a quarter from Saudi Arabia.

So it’s no wonder that the prelude for Xi of Arabia’s lavish welcome in Riyadh was a special op-ed expanding the trading scope, and praising increased strategic/commercial partnerships across the GCC, complete with “5G communications, new energy, space and digital economy.” ...

description:
– Reon Energy is proud to announce that its recent installation of a 5.3 MW bus charging station in collaboration with Redco International Qatar made it the Guinness Book of World Records for being the largest bus charging station in the world.
The first-of-its-kind solar bus charging depot in Al Lusail, Qatar was implemented for FIFA World Cup 2022. The project aims to support transportation operations during FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 and beyond.

The 5.3 MW project powers the operation of 241 buses roughly facilitating 23,700 fans during the World Cup. The main goal of the project is to increase public transit ridership and to switch to clean energy in transportation to improve overall air and climate quality in Qatar.

The project will achieve an annual energy generation of 7,843 MWh and achieve carbon savings of 4,823.98 tonnes.
Reon, a part of the Dawood Group, is Pakistan’s leading Solar and Storage Solutions Specialist with deep domain expertise in project development, financial advisory, Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC), and asset performance management. Our portfolio includes industrial solutions for cement, oil and gas, coal mining, textile, dairy, and telecommunications.

Reon is committed to a sustainable energy future to enable economic growth and greater well-being.

Redco International is a leading industrial manufacturing and contracting group operating in Qatar since 1982. Redco International has been a leader in precast concrete manufacturing and erection in Qatar since the 1980s and is also among the leaders in ready-mix concrete manufacturing, steel cut & bend, Mechanical-Electrical Plumbing (MEP), and building works (general contracting).

description:
Well, what an amazing journey that was, working in the Oil and Gas Industry. 3 years with ConocoPhillips and 3 with Santos (in Jan).

I appreciate all of the support everyone has given me throughout the years and am grateful, and proud of the experiences and opportunities.

The biggest highlights throughout my career with ConocoPhillips and Santos were:

- Taken on as an Indigenous Administration Trainee at Darwin LNG in 2017 with very minimal knowledge and experience in a large company, not to mention a technical Industry
- Completed my Certificate III, IV and Diploma in Business Admin all whilst work supported me every step of the way
- Winning the Northern Territory ‘Trainee of the Year’ and taking home the Australian ‘Trainee of the Year’ (go NT!) in 2018
- Scored the 2018 Charles Darwin University College Dean Award for Outstanding Achievement and Most Outstanding Student in Certificate IV in Business Administration
- At the start of 2019 I was promoted from Admin trainee to Business Services Coordinator and spent some years in the Darwin Office
- The first day of the CoP/Santos acquisition I was taken on Full-Time by Santos as the NT Community Coordinator
- Promoted in late 2022 to an Adviser

I am off on a new adventure with Price Waterhouse Coopers Indigenous Consulting as a Senior Associate, and I hope to bring them my Industry knowledge and experience. Highly doubt this’ll be my last stint in the Resources sector, but for now, I’ll enjoy the ride and continue to broaden my skillset.

2023 is going to be an amazing year!

description:
Vice President of AAPL & NAPE Le'Ann Callihan has been selected as an honoree for Oil and Gas Investor and Hart Energy’s annual 25 Influential Women in Energy program! The 25 Influential Women in Energy program celebrates professional women who have excelled in any sector of the oil and gas industry. Le’Ann is joined by representatives from top energy companies like Deloitte, Devon Energy, Energy Transfer, Exxon Mobil, KPMG and Savvy Oil & Gas Consulting, among others.

From a college intern to director of communications and NAPE Expo LP, Le’Ann has made an extraordinary mark on AAPL and the land profession over the past three decades. Congratulations, Le’Ann, on this great honor and thank you for representing our association so well!

#PoweringtheProfession #AmericasLandmen

description:
7. Discounted Russian oil not ‘a reality,’ says Bilawal: Pakistan is seeking “to address the energy shortfalls and difficulties we’re facing,” Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari said on Thursday, but he dismissed the concept of discounted Russian oil after Islamabad announced a deal with Moscow. (BR) https://lnkd.in/du4sfEsE

8. Attock Refinery shutdown to create POL, gas crisis up north: Northern Pakistan would experience a shortage of POL products, once Attock Refinery Limited’s (ARL) crude storage hits maximum capacity in 6-7 days, leading to low refining capacity, Energy Ministry officials the told The News. (TN) https://lnkd.in/da-TT2Qs

9. SBP reserves drop $15m: Foreign exchange reserves held by the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) didn't see a major change on week on week basis, closing at a level of $6.7 billion after shedding $15 million, SBP data released on Thursday showed. (TN) https://lnkd.in/dhY-MaTd

10. Shortage of essential goods feared: Indu­stria­lists fear that the country could face a shortage of essential commodities in the coming weeks as an unannounced ban on the import of goods and non- clearance of raw material consignments from the port had resulted in huge demurrages. description:
Women have to be an integral part of our energy transition because, quite simply, we cannot let half of our population miss out on energy industry opportunities.

There are many women already in the industry who have excelled. Women have started successful energy companies, serve as executive leaders in oil and gas companies, and spearhead innovation.

It would be tragic to usher in a bright era of renewable energy in Africa that leaves women on the sidelines. Doing right by women is not a side issue or icing on the cake. And we can’t talk about a just, equitable energy transition if we’re willing to do that.

Isn’t it time to give Africa its best chance at controlling the narrative and utilizing ALL of its available talent to become an international clean energy leader?
#womanleadership #energy #ajusttransition #oilandgas

description:
Life is hard, it’s harder if you do nothing, therefore, you need the best resources and tools to keep succeeding!

𝟏𝟎 𝐄𝐒𝐒𝐄𝐍𝐓𝐈𝐀𝐋𝐒 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐍𝐄𝐖𝐋𝐘 𝐇𝐈𝐑𝐄𝐃 𝐄𝐌𝐏𝐋𝐎𝐘𝐄𝐄𝐒 𝐀𝐍𝐃 𝐉𝐎𝐁 𝐒𝐄𝐄𝐊𝐄𝐑𝐒

1. LinkedIn

Did you know that LinkedIn has actually been around longer than Facebook, Twitter and Instagram? LinkedIn is such an important networking tool for professionals.

With the splurge of online hiring, finding and posting jobs on LinkedIn have become ever more important and prominent. The platform is one of the most trusted in the world and according to stats, 3 people are hired through LinkedIn every minute.


2. grammarly.com

Grammar, regardless of the country or the language, is the foundation for communication, the better the grammar, the clearer the message. Grammarly reviews spelling, grammar, punctuation, clarity, engagement, and delivery mistakes in English texts, detects plagiarism, and suggests replacements for the identified errors.

3. quillbot.com

QuillBot is an AI writing collaborator that rewrites full paragraphs and refines content. Of course, email writing isn’t about filling a page with words, it’s about being concise. Paraphrasing helps you make your point more clearly and quickly.

4. poised.com

If you want to grow as a verbal communicator, to present like a boss, to have outstanding interview, poised.com can help you improve your skills. Poised gives you real-time feedback on everything from words most spoken to filler words, confidence, energy, empathy, and more.

5. resumeworded.com

Resume Worded has helped hundreds of people land jobs at top companies. They will guide you through the process of creating your most effective resume and (Applicant Tracking System) ATS friendly resume.

6. glassdoor.com

In addition to using, it as a job search engine, you may always use indeed to learn more about your future employer by reading reviews left by its current or past employees, it may provide you a general picture of the business you will work for.

7. mprc.gov.my

Most of us are only familiar with the leading oil and gas firm in Malaysia, but did you know that smaller company will increase your chances of breaking into the oil and gas industry? A comprehensive list of Malaysia's oil and gas firms may be found here.

8. Power BI

Power BI offers a full summary of company data in visual form, with display choices such as tables, charts, gauges, and maps, making it easier for teams to use it.

9. evernote.com

Evernote is a note-taking and task management application. It is intended for archiving and creating notes in which photos, audio and saved web content can be embedded. Notes are stored in virtual "notebooks" and can be tagged, annotated, edited, searched, and exported.

10. ricebowl.my

Are you looking for a job? EZ PZ to find your dream jobs @ Ricebowl Malaysia!
Try it for FREE now 👉 https://cutt.ly/EBnUGIO

#ricebowl #ricebowlMY #findjobswithricebowl #ricebowlcareer #ricebowljobs

description:
Urgent opening for one of the leading Heavy Engineering company in India

Location - Mumbai

Interested candidates can send their CV's on gautami.mathakar@cieltech.io

Position:
1. Lead Electrical Engineer -
The Candidate should be B.E./M. E (Electrical) from a renowned university.
• Should have 10-14 years of experience.
• The Candidate must have experience in basic & detailed engineering of Process Plants such as Fertilizers, Chemicals, Petrochemicals, Refinery, Specialty Chemicals, Oil & Gas Projects, Off-Sites and Utility facilities.
• Candidates must have Electrical & Instrumentation design & engineering experience of at least 4 to 5 complete Project Life Cycles as EPC/EPCM in green field/ brown field and Revamp type of projects.
• Knowledge of all aspects of complex refinery, fertilizer, chemical, petrochemical and oil & gas projects. Candidates shall have a very strong understanding of all Project Specifications, drawings, documents and data sheets to be generated and reviewed for typical refinery/ Fertilizer/ Chemical/Petrochemical projects.
• Candidate should be competent enough to provide cost effective, value addition suggestion adding value to EPC project Exposure to FEED, Detail Engineering, Pre-bid activities of projects Strong technical skills Knowledge of good engineering & global practices followed in Electrical Engineering, Instrumentation, Control System & Automation in the Plant.
• Lead the Electrical Engineering activities and deliverables for the project and ensure timely completion to the required quality standards. Execute technical work for FEED/DD within designated Cost Time & Resource (CTR) scopes. Develop concept and feasibility studies for new and modification of existing facilities.
• Detailed understanding of the activities related to electrical systems design development including Cable Scheduling and Routing Design (above and below ground), Lighting Design (including lighting design software application), Earthing Systems, Hazardous Area Classification, high, medium and low voltage systems and Electrical Bulk Material Take-off.
• Development and checking of common electrical design drawings and deliverables including Single Line Diagrams, Block Cable Diagrams, Schematic/Connection Diagrams, General Electrical Equipment Layouts including Sub-station Layouts, Lighting Layouts, Earthing Layouts, Lightning Layouts, Cable & Drum Schedules & Bulk material requisitions.
• Fully familiar with international codes, standards and recommended practices standards like ANSI, IEEE, IEC, NEC, NEMA, UL, Aramco standards, etc.
• Strong Understanding of Inputs and interface with various disciplines such as Process, Electrical & Instrumentation, Civil & Structural, Mechanical - Static, Mechanical - Rotary, Piping and Planning, Project management, Execution Etc.
• Application of Industry standard CAD systems to produce 2-D electrical drawings and 3-D modelling systems, such as PDS, PDMS or SP3D, ETAP and PSCAD/EMTP.

description:
As I sit at my desk at Safetec UK Limited's offices at Marischal Square in Aberdeen, listening to the strains of Christmas music from the Christmas Market which I can see from my office, I am reflecting on yet another year for me as Managing Director at Safetec UK Limited. For the 3rd consecutive year, we have further established our presence across a range of market sectors in the UK, grown sales, revenue and profitability, whilst also building the core staff team up to 11 full-time people (with more scheduled to join us in 2023!).

As well as continuing to work closely with our oil and gas clients (operators and EPC companies), we have significantly strengthened our market presence in decommissioning (including waste management services), operations safety support, hydrogen and CCUS (both domestically and on international projects in Norway, Australia and the USA), auditing/gap analyses, human factors, and environmental advisory support on offshore wind, onshore projects, and oil and gas projects/operations.

If someone was to have told me when I left my previous employer in 2019, that I would join Safetec in late 2019 and oversee an increase in turnover equating to 10 x times that of when I joined, even as an optimist, I would have laughed at them. However, that has proven to be the reality and I continue to be astounded as to how much the market has embraced Safetec and how brilliant the team that I have assembled has been in exceeding our revenue/profit/sales targets year upon year.

As I sign off for another year to take some well-deserved (if I do say so myself!) time away from the rigours of work with my family, I wanted to say thank you once more to all of Safetec's clients, our brilliant subcontractors, my fabulous staff team and all of the people who were willing to listen to me wax lyrical about Safetec and what we are able to offer you or your company! A massive thanks also to those who have motivated me to persist and drive myself and my team to achieve what we have achieved this year.

Furthermore, with some major project wins on the horizon, we are always looking to add to our ever growing team. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you are looking for a new challenge at a dynamic company with a strong client base and a host of diverse, ongoing projects.

Finally, thank you to our colleagues at Safetec Nordic and Safetec Sweden AB who have been instrumental in the past year in providing support to many of the projects conducted by Safetec in the UK. Collaboration is key and I am encouraged by how well all component parts of the Safetec group have worked together on cross-country projects.

Nothing more to say besides I hope that you all have a wonderful Christmas and a brilliant 2023! All the best to you and yours :-)

#yourbusinessissafewithus #safetec #technicalsafety #processsafety #riskmanagement #environmental #consequencemodelling #oilandgas #hydrogen #ccus #offshorewind #offshore

description:
"Corona is natural or pre-launch"


What is the reason for the economic problems after Corona? Why not control the inflation? Leave these states to us.

1. Before Corona, there were many news that by 2030, China will become a super power and will do it.

2. If you think that these are natural disasters, then you have read only popular literature.

3. It is our duty not to understand that all these institutions and companies of capitalism are behind it, and exploiting them through our products is now the first duty under the guise of Corona.

4 Look at a company that makes oil, gas, coal machinery, everyone is accusing them that if they are selling at such a high price, how can I fulfill my greed and greed account.

5. Now, sir, where is the national system?
Those who don't give it are killed in the case of RAW agent or smuggling.

This Lord will appear to you if you do not kiss the people of your thoughts.

And accusers stay away.

6. Exploitation is seen in front of the coming generations.

So what is the solution now, when capitalism ends in one country and moves to another country, will people become godly paradises or will the exploitative mind wake up again? Food, Thought, Books, Beliefs, Teachers, Prejudice in the first place are all bogus institutions in the name of education.

7. Jan Jagar, it is difficult to get out by yourself. If you find a solution, please let us know
Liver so that I can stop burning liver.

Be happy with little desires, or else you too start exploiting and make your desires unlimited.

description:
Moving to a New Future

I am after much deliberation leaving the Oil and Gas business, this after many years of working with wonderful people in an industry utilising leading edge technologies and adapting to the energy transition. Christmas holidays are starting and in the New year I will be moving into another stalwart pillar of our modern life the steel industry. This will be in Sweden where some of the best steel in the world has been produced. There has been a long history in world since the industrial revolution of steel from Ironbridge, the birthplace of the Industrial Revolution ( Ironbridge.org.uk ) to where I am going H2 Green Steel ( H2GreenSteel.com ) which will be the start of the “revolution for life” where industries we rely on adapt and transform in line with the knowledge we are gaining of the environment. To everyone I have been working with in whatever capacity – Thank you every interaction has built knowledge that goes with me, remember your future is today.
Enjoy your Christmas and festive season Med Vänliga Hälsningar Craig.

description:
Established in 2018, PT Interport Mandiri Utama, a subsidiary of PT Indika Energy Tbk, is a world-class shore base operator and logistics infrastructure trusted by international oil, gas and mining companies operating domestically.

PT Interport Mandiri Utama operates by applying international standards in its operational areas, our site is in Bekasi (West Java), Balikpapan (Kalimantan), Surabaya (East Java), and Sorong (West Papua).

We are pleased to inform that we are hiring for:

COMPLIANCE & OPERATION SUPPORT SUPERITENDENT


Responsible to organize operation of waste management comply with environmental legislation, pollution prevention and recycling program, auditing and reporting on environmental performance to internal and external clients and regulatory bodies. To ensure activities of operation waste management are carried out according to standard.

Qualifications:
· Minimum Diploma degree in Environmental Engineering / Industrial Engineering / related to the business scope, with experience 5-7 years in Oil & Gas Company
· Ability to communicate effectively both oral and in writing, with Clients, subordinates, superiors and other third parties related to base operations.
· Willing to work extend hours to meet the target
· Must be available for on-call duty in emergency situations
· Ability to manage and maintain data and task analysis
· Knowledge of best practices in regulatory bodies
· Ability to develop and maintain effective monitoring and control mechanism
· Good communication with Bahasa Indonesia and English
· Assignment at HO Jakarta


So, what you are waiting for? Send your updated CV and other document with subject email (COMPLIANCE & OPERATION SUPPORT SUPERITENDENT) to recruitment@interport.co.id

description:
"During the nine months of Russia’s full-scale war against Ukraine, China took the position of “neither yours nor ours.”
But now the leader of China, Xi Jinping, has instructed the government to establish closer economic relations with the Russian Federation, which may indicate that Beijing has finally decided to side with the Russian Federation.
This was reported by The Wall Street Journal, citing Beijing’s political advisers.
The publication’s authors write that the leader of China “has admired Putin for a long time” and that he “doubles his bet on the president of the Russian Federation.” The 69-year-old Chinese leader is expected to visit Moscow next year, probably after China’s legislative session in March, Russian Ambassador to Beijing Igor Morgulov told reporters recently.
China’s plan calls for increasing Chinese imports of Russian oil, gas, and agricultural goods, strengthening the energy partnership in the Arctic, and increasing Chinese investment in Russian infrastructure, such as railways and ports.
In a written statement, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said, “China and Russia are each other’s comprehensive strategic partners. The development of bilateral relations is based on non-alignment, non-confrontation, and non-targeting of third parties.”
Xi calls the decision to deepen economic cooperation between China and Russia a “turn” in the bilateral relations between the countries, which intensified immediately before the Russian invasion of Ukraine and were “put on pause” for some time.
“China’s partnership with Russia has helped shield Moscow from the economic fallout of Western sanctions, allowing leader Vladimir Putin to continue his war. Russia and China conduct more financial transactions in rubles and yuan than euros or dollars, which helps protect them from future sanctions and impose Chinese currency into wider circulation,” WSJ journalists note."

Russia and China conduct more financial transactions in rubles and yuan than euros or dollars, which helps protect them from future sanctions and impose Chinese currency into wider circulation,” WSJ journalists note."

description:
Did I pass the test?

That was what I asked myself after having spent almost two hours being questioned by four very engaged young minds – four people that will be 50 in 2050.

This autumn, Ailin, Milan, Mari and Madeleine were invited to spend time understanding the energy crisis and the climate crisis, and to make up their own opinion. Is the world, Norway and Equinor set to reach the target of net-zero in 2050? Will we pass the biggest test?

The participants were introduced to all parts of our business, from oil and gas, to offshore renewables and low carbon solutions like CCS and hydrogen. Our ambition with the series was to both increase the knowledge about our business and our ambitions in the energy transition, but even more important – to facilitate an open dialogue about what it takes to solve both the energy crisis and the energy transition.

We wanted to invite young people with different perspectives to explore the issues together, creating a space for dialogue and exchanges of views outside the polarized trenches that often characterize the debate.

In the fifth and final episode, I met them at the Kårstø gas processing plant, and they came well prepared with a lot of challenging questions. I don’t think they are convinced that our answers are the right ones in every aspect, but I believe we managed to agree on some important topics: The energy transition is extremely complex and challenging and it will take a broad set of industrial solutions to solve it.

We all agree that we want to reach net zero by 2050, and that the Paris Agreement goal of keeping the world below 1,5 degrees warming is worth fighting for. And, that nothing can be done if we are not collaborating, across industries, societies and geographies.

You can see the episodes here:
https://lnkd.in/dZCyK8-5

#energytransition #renewables #dialogue

description:
NIT Srinagar alumnus Sai Karthik Sunkara in collaboration with IIT Madras developed a device called Sindhuja-1, and carried out an experiment to generate power at Tuticorin in Tamil Nadu in November 2022.

Sai Karthik Sunkara has done his B.Tech in Civil Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Srinagar.

In February 2020, Sai Karthik Sunkara thought of generating power from the waves in oceans. In December 2020, he started working with the Ocean Engineering Department of IIT-Madras, as the institution was working on the same idea of generating electricity from sea waves.

Mr. Karthik has launched a startup called Virya Paramita Energy (VPE), and signed a joint development agreement with IIT-Madras to take the project forward.
Collaboratively they developed a device called, ‘Ocean Wave Energy Converter’, or Sindhuja-1, to generate power from the waves.
In November 2022, the device was deployed 6 km off the coast of Tuticorin in Tamil Nadu and placed at a depth of 20 metres.

In the endeavour, he is taking the support from the National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT), Chennai.
Karthik and his team at IIT-Madras believe that ocean energy is a better green energy option over other renewable energies such as solar and wind.

“Ocean waves can generate power 24x7 with minimal battery storage. It is the best choice for marine surveillance, offshore desalination plants, drone charging, underwater vehicle charging, weather buoys, defence ships, ports, and oil and gas installations,” he says.

Read more :

https://lnkd.in/d7kmsAuv

#startup #development #technology #energy #nitsriofficial #Srinagar #Kashmir #nits #engineering

We are #hiring Process/Project Engineer

Scope of Responsibilities
• Assist the Engineering Manager in the day-to-day work performance.
• Plan, coordinate and supervise major engineering work and activities of the oil and gas project.
• Identify and resolve engineering issues which are critical for project schedule and cost.
• Execution of a significant design task with minimal supervision
• Generate detailed engineering drawing, conduct engineering analysis and recommend technical solutions.
• Check the engineering deliverables for correctness and quality, marks-up any comments or revision on these documents and ensure that the changes are included and completed on the latest copies of all affected documents.
• Motivate project teams' personnel and to encourage across the functions involved in a project to maximize the productivity and morale of the project.
• Conduct technical review of the project to ensure compliance to client's specification.
• Overall and detailed engineering design, associated calculations and specifications of all civil works required for the onshore, offshore oil and gas production facilities.
• Overall supervision of the engineers under him or her, the overall design work and endorsement of detailed designs related to instrument works.
• Perform duty as Process Engineer as and when required.
• Undertake any other duties as appropriate within their competency, as required by their supervisor from time to time.
• Integrate and/or consider Quality, Health, Safety, Security and Environmental (QHSSE) element in all activities to ensure company’s QHSSE objectives and targets are met.
• Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively.

Requirement
- A recognized degree in Chemical Engineering or relevant field.
- Registered with Board of Engineers Malaysia or Institute of Engineers Malaysia or other board of professional engineers recognized by BEM or IEM.
- 5 - 10 years of solid working experience in Oil & Gas Industry in Engineering Consultancy firm.
- At least 5 years experience in offshore engineering design.

Please share your resume at recruitment@t7global.com.my

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Thanks all
